en.account_nav_info: Manage your data like your username and password
en.analyze_duration_info: Specify how many microseconds are analyzed to probe the input. A higher value will enable detecting more accurate information, but will increase latency. It defaults to 5,000,000 microseconds = 5 seconds (-analyzeduration).
en.appearance_nav_info: Change the language or the appearance of the interface
en.atleast_one_permission_required: Atleast one permission must be selected
en.audio_codec_info: Set the codec used for encoding audio sent to HomeKit for HSV, must be AAC-based (-acodec).
en.backup_info_download: Download a backup archive of your entire camera.ui environment. This will backup the entire contents (including recordings) of your camera.ui storage directory. You can restore this later on any platform on which camera.ui is running
en.backup_info_restore: Restore a backup archive you previously made using camera.ui. Your camera.ui config, database, recordings and camera.ui user accounts will be restored
en.backup_info_shedule: A full backup of the camera.ui database is automatically created every day at 12:00:00 and kept for 7 days
en.backup_nav_info: Create and manage the backup copies from the interface
en.bitrate_info: The bitrate used for video stream.
en.cameras_nav_info: Manage the streaming parameters of the cameras
en.debug_info: Includes debugging output from the main FFmpeg process in the log.
en.doorbellSensor_info: Exposes the doorbell device for this camera. This can be triggered with the dummy switches, MQTT messages, or via HTTP, depending on what features are enabled in the config.
en.encoder_options_info: Options to be passed to the video encoder.
en.excludeSwitch_info: Exposes a 'exclude' switch to HomeKit to exclude/include the camera from the interface settings within HomeKit.
en.forgotpw_content: If you have forgotten your password, you can restore it by deleting the database or importing a backup.
en.fps_info: The fps used for video stream.
en.height_info: The height used for video stream.
en.help_started: To help you get started and provide good experience with camera.ui, please complete the following configuration.
en.interface_nav_info: Create new rooms or make other settings
en.label: Label
en.livestream_snapshot: Switches between live stream or snapshot interval
en.manufacturer_info: Set the manufacturer name for display in the Home app
en.map_audio_info: Selects the stream used for audio (-map).
en.map_video_info: Selects the stream used for video (-map).
en.max_delay_info: When receiving data over UDP, the demuxer tries to reorder received packets (since they may arrive out of order, or packets may get lost totally). This can be disabled by setting the maximum demuxing delay to zero (-max_delay).
en.max_streams_info: The maximum number of streams that will be allowed at once to this camera.
en.model_info: Set the model for display in the Home app
en.motionDoorbellSwitch_info: Enables dummy switches to trigger motion and/or doorbell, if either of those are enabled. When enabled there will be an additional switch that triggers the motion or doorbell event.
en.motionDoorbell_info: Rings the doorbell when motion is activated. This allows for motion alerts to appear on Apple TVs.
en.motionSensor_info: Exposes the motion sensor for this camera. This can be triggered with the dummy switches, MQTT messages, or via HTTP, depending on what features are enabled in the config.
en.motion_timeout_info: The number of seconds after triggering to reset the motion sensor. Set to 0 to disable resetting of motion trigger for MQTT or HTTP.
en.name: Name
en.notfound_message: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist.
en.notification_text: @ detected a new movement in room %
en.notifications_nav_info: Manage the Alexa, Telegram and Webhook settings
en.page_not_found: The page you requested could not be found.
en.press_enter_to_create: Press %Enter% to create a new label
en.privacyMode_info: Turn off the camera feed and replace it with a privacy image in HomeKit
en.privacySwitch_info: Exposes a 'privacyMode' switch to replace the camera feed with a privacy image in HomeKit
en.probe_size_info: Set probing size in bytes, i.e. the size of the data to analyze to get stream information. A higher value will enable detecting more information in case it is dispersed into the stream, but will increase latency. Must be an integer not lesser than 32. It is 5000000 by default (-probesize).
en.read_rate_info: Read input at native frame rate (-re).
en.record_on_movement_info: Enables recording video (eg on movement) through UI and NOT through external controller.
en.recording_text: The @ was taken on % by a #.
en.recording_timer_not_editable: Recording time cannot be edited. Settings can be changed in config.json.
en.recording_type_not_editable: Recording type cannot be edited. Settings can be changed in config.json.
en.recordings_nav_info: Manage the recording settings and specify the recording type
en.rekognition_nav_info: Image analysis for motion detection via Amazon Rekognition
en.remove_all_confirm_text: After clicking 'Remove all' all stored @ will be irrevocably deleted. Are you sure?
en.reorder_queue_size_info: Packets may be received out of order, so before they can be passed onwards, they need to be reordered. Default jitter buffer size is 500. This option allows you to specify it manually. Higher values will lead to greater latency. Only applicable for reception over UDP (-reorder_queue_size).
en.reset_confirm_text: After clicking 'Reset' all stored data will be irrevocably deleted. Are you sure?
en.restart_confirm_text: Do you really want to reboot @?
en.rss_feed_widget_info: Please enter a valid RSS URL to see the feed in the widget.
en.serialNumber_info: Set the serial number for display in the Home app
en.shortcuts_widget_info: Please select the action from the list to show it in the shortcuts.
en.source_info: FFmpeg options on where to find and how to decode your camera's video stream. The most basic form is '-i' followed by your camera's URL.
en.start_end_message:
And thats it.
Have fun with camera.ui!
en.start_info_message:
U moet uw inloggegevens wijzigen
voordat u inlogt op camera.ui
en.still_image_source_info: If your camera also provides a URL for a still image, that can be defined here with the same syntax as 'source'. If not set, camera.ui will grab one frame from 'source'.
en.system_nav_info: Manage the backend settings of camera.ui
en.telegram_type_not_editable: Telegram cannot be changed for this camera.
en.timeout_info: Socket TCP I/O timeout in seconds. If you have problems with hanging FFmpeg processes in the background, you can enter any value here to stop the process automatically after the entered time, if no response comes (-stimeout).
en.unbridge_info: Bridged cameras can cause slowdowns of the entire Homebridge instance. If unbridged, the camera will need to be added to HomeKit manually.
en.users_nav_info: Delete existing users or create new ones
en.video_codec_info: Set the codec used for encoding video sent to HomeKit, must be H.264-based. You can change to a hardware accelerated video codec with this option, if one is available (-vcodec).
en.video_filter_info: Comma-delimited list of additional video filters for FFmpeg to run on the video. If 'none' is included, the default video filters are disabled (-filter:v).
en.weather_widget_info: Please search for your city name in English to activate the weather widget.
en.weather_widget_info_owm: Weather data is provided by OpenWeather.
en.welcome_submessage: The web interface for your RTSP capable cameras
en.width_info: The width used for video stream.
